Package com.bfo.zeroconf

Class Zeroconf

java.lang.Object
com.bfo.zeroconf.Zeroconf
public class Zeroconf extends Object

This is the root class for the Service Discovery object, which can be used to announce a Service, listen for announcements or both. Typical use to announce a Sevice: 

 Zeroconf zc = new Zeroconf();
 Service service = new Service.Builder().setName("MyWeb").setType("_http._tcp").setPort(8080).put("path", "/path/toservice").build(zc);
 service.announce();
 // time passes
 service.cancel();
 // time passes
 zc.close();
And to retrieve records, either add a ZeroconfListener by calling addListener(com.bfo.zeroconf.ZeroconfListener), or simply traverse the Collection returned from getServices(). Services will be added when they are heard on the network - to ask the network to announce them, see query(java.lang.String, java.lang.String). 
 Zeroconf zc = new Zeroconf();
 zc.addListener(new ZeroconfListener() {
   public void serviceNamed(String type, String name) {
     if ("_http._tcp.local".equals(type)) {
       // Ask for details on any announced HTTP services
       zc.query(type, name);
     }
   }
 });
 // Ask for any HTTP services
 zc.query("_http._tcp.local", null);
 // time passes
 for (Service s : zc.getServices()) {
   if (s.getType().equals("_http._tcp") {
     // We've found an HTTP service
   }
 }
 // time passes
 zc.close();

This class does not have any fancy hooks to clean up. The close() method should be called when the class is to be discarded, but failing to do so won't break anything. Announced services will expire in their own time, which is typically two minutes - although during this time, conforming implementations should refuse to republish any duplicate services.

  • Constructor Details

    • Zeroconf

      public Zeroconf()
      Create a new Zeroconf object

  • Method Details

    • close

      public void close() throws InterruptedException
      Close down this Zeroconf object and cancel any services it has advertised. Once closed, a Zeroconf object cannot be reopened.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if we couldn't rejoin the listener thread

    • addListener

      public Zeroconf addListener(ZeroconfListener listener)
      Add a ZeroconfListener to the list of listeners notified of events
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener
      Returns:
      this

    • removeListener

      public Zeroconf removeListener(ZeroconfListener listener)
      Remove a previously added ZeroconfListener from the list of listeners notified of events
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener
      Returns:
      this

    • getNetworkInterfaces

      public Collection<NetworkInterface> getNetworkInterfaces()

      Return a modifiable Collection containing the interfaces that send and received Service Discovery Packets. All the interface's IP addresses will be added to the getLocalAddresses() list, and if that list changes or the interface goes up or down, the list will be updated automatically.

      The default list is everything from NetworkInterface.getNetworkInterfaces(). Interfaces that don't support Multicast or that are loopbacks are silently ignored. Interfaces that have both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses will listen on both protocols if possible.

      Returns:
      a modifiable collection of NetworkInterface objects

    • getDomain

      public String getDomain()
      Get the Service Discovery Domain, which is set by setDomain(java.lang.String). It defaults to ".local", but can be set by setDomain(java.lang.String)
      Returns:
      the domain

    • setDomain

      public Zeroconf setDomain(String domain)
      Set the Service Discovery Domain
      Parameters:
      domain - the domain
      Returns:
      this

    • setIPv4

      public Zeroconf setIPv4(boolean ipv4)
      Set whether announcements should be made on IPv4 addresses (default=true)
      Parameters:
      ipv4 - whether to announce on IPv4 addresses
      Returns:
      this
      Since:
      1.0.1

    • setIPv6

      public Zeroconf setIPv6(boolean ipv6)
      Set whether announcements should be made on IPv6 addresses (default=true)
      Parameters:
      ipv6 - whether to announce on IPv4 addresses
      Returns:
      this
      Since:
      1.0.1

    • getLocalHostName

      public String getLocalHostName()
      Get the local hostname, which defaults to InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostName()
      Returns:
      the local host name

    • setLocalHostName

      public Zeroconf setLocalHostName(String name)
      Set the local hostname, as returned by getLocalHostName(). It should not have a dot - the fully-qualified name will be created by appending this value to getDomain()
      Parameters:
      name - the hostname, which should be undotted
      Returns:
      this

    • getLocalAddresses

      public Collection<InetAddress> getLocalAddresses()
      Return a list of InetAddresses which the Zeroconf object considers to be "local". These are the all the addresses of all the NetworkInterface objects added to this object. The returned list is a copy, it can be modified and will not be updated by this object.
      Returns:
      a List of local InetAddress objects

    • getAnnouncedServices

      public Collection<Service> getAnnouncedServices()
      Return the list of all Services that have been announced by this object. The returned Collection is read-only, thread-safe without synchronization and live - it will be updated by this object.
      Returns:
      the Collection of announced Services

    • getServices

      public Collection<Service> getServices()
      Return the list of all Services that have been heard by this object. It may contain Services that are also in getAnnouncedServices() The returned Collection is read-only, thread-safe without synchronization and live - it will be updated by this object.
      Returns:
      the Collection of Services

    • getServiceTypes

      public Collection<String> getServiceTypes()
      Return the list of type names that have been heard by this object, eg "_http._tcp.local" The returned Collection is read-only, thread-safe without synchronization and live - it will be updated by this object.
      Returns:
      the Collection of type names.

    • getServiceNames

      public Collection<String> getServiceNames()
      Return the list of fully-qualified service names that have been heard by this object The returned Collection is read-only, thread-safe without synchronization and live - it will be updated by this object.
      Returns:
      the Collection of fully-qualfied service names.

    • query

      public void query(String type, String name)
      Send a query to the network to probe for types or services. Any responses will trigger changes to the list of services, and usually arrive within a second or two.
      Parameters:
      type - the service type, eg "_http._tcp" (getDomain() will be appended if necessary), or null to query for known types
      name - the service instance name, or null to discover services of the specified type
